page.title: 03POPULATION OF BALQUHIDDER
page.content: Balquhidder has always been a farming area. Farms have been passed down from generation to generation. Up till recently farms have supported families of farm hands and shepherds. However, within the last 30 years, when shepherds moved away, they have not been replaced and their houses have either been used as holiday homes or sold very often as retirement homes. The result is that firstly, the population of the glen has fallen and secondly, incomers are now in the majority. Strangely enough many of the new residents have come from abroad. Balquhidder is now quite an international community with families from Iceland, Holland, Germany, Spain and England. The birth rate has fallen and as children grow up they leave the glen for employment elsewhere.
